alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 6:39PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Tanana River from Delta Junction to Fairbanks * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is occurring in low lying areas along the Tanana River from Delta Junction to Fairbanks and further downriver. In Fairbanks, several inches of water is flowing over the Melanie Lane and Chief John Drive and going overbank nearby at Perkins Landing. Several driveways and yards are inundated with water. Minor flooding is also occuring around the boat landing at Whitestone Farms near Delta Junction. Minor flooding or bankfull conditions are expected through Saturday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 500 PM AKDT, heavy rain that fell over the south slopes of the Alaska Range from Denali to the Alcan Border is causing high water to flow down the Delta River and other rivers draining the Alaska Range. This has caused the Tanana River to rise to bankfull and overbank in some locations. Additional heavy rain in the Alaska Range the next few days and will result in more runoff into the Tanana River. - For Tanana River at Big Delta: At 5:00pm Wed the stage was 22.5 feet. Flood Stage is 23.0 feet. Forecast: The river is expected to remain steady at this level into Friday. For Tanana River at Fairbanks: At 5:00pm Wed the stage was 25.3 feet. Flood Stage is 24.5 feet. Forecast: The river is expected to remain steady at this level into Saturday. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Tanana River from Delta Junction to Fairbanks, you are encouraged to monitor water levels.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
